title: Do you think the media entertainment industry's 'obsession' with transmedia storytelling will turn audiences away? - Quora

response.answer_text: I had to actually look it up to even know what it is. So I’m not sure the entertainment industry is as “obsessed” as you say. There are definitely things like the Marvel or DC comics that have the IP expressed in comics, movies, toys, cartoons, digital TV series, etc. If that’s what you mean, then … I don’t see that changing, and I certainly don’t see it turning audiences away. I’m not aware of any kind of storytelling that requires you to follow the story from one platform or delivery mechanism to another … like a film that gives you only part the story, then you need to watch the TV, then read the book, to get a full picture. Often these things are there but additional. So the film, TV show, and book are all full stories, just complementing each other. Not sure how that’s bad.
